article.description: John Gilchrist scored 20 points and fueled a second-half run that carried Maryland (No. 21 ESPN/USA Today, No. 24 AP) past American University 82-61 on Thursday night.
article.headline: Terps win 12th straight against American
article.linkText: Gilchrist sparks run that paces No. 21 Maryland
article.story: COLLEGE PARK, Md. (AP) -- An uneven performance by Maryland (No. 21 ESPN/USA Today, No. 24 AP) gave coach Gary Williams and his inconsistent basketball team plenty to think about over the holiday break. John Gilchrist scored 20 points, and the Terrapins used a second-half surge to beat American University 82-61 on Thursday night. Nik Caner-Medley had 16 points and Travis Garrison added 14 for Maryland, which led by only two points before Gilchrist tossed an alley-oop pass to freshman James Gist, starting a 16-0 run that made it 66-48 with 6:19 left. "We're pretty good when we're going on both ends of the court," Williams said. "We did the second half. We played with a good emotional level." But for 30 minutes, the Eagles hung with the defending Atlantic Coast Conference champions, giving Williams cause to wonder if the Terrapins will be competitive in a league that has seven teams in the Top 25. "I don't think anyone played well the first half. Whoever went in there didn't play well," he said. "There are some things I still have to figure out about this team. Hopefully I'll come up with some answers." Gilchrist and Ekene Ibekwe each scored four points during the 16-0 spree, which propelled Maryland (7-2) to its third consecutive victory. It was the fourth straight game that Gilchrist scored at least 20 points. Yet, the Terrapins struggled for much of the game against a team they beat last season by 31 points. "It's unacceptable to come out and play like that in the first half," Caner-Medley said. "We have to be mature about it. We all understand that, and that's why we played the way we did in the second half. It was a wake-up call." It was also something that probably will prevent Williams from completely enjoying the Christmas break. "That's why basketball coaching during the holidays is not a good job," he said. "Now you worry about the first half until you practice again on the 26th. You don't get that freedom of forgetting about things and just enjoying the holidays." The Terrapins have won 12 in a row over American since 1926, when the Eagles won the first game of the series. Williams, who began his college coaching career at American in 1978, improved to 9-0 against his former school. Jason Thomas scored 14 points for the Eagles (5-3), whose five-game winning streak ended. American was seeking to go 6-2 for the first time since 1982-83 -- one year after Williams left. "I think we got worn down," American coach Jeff Jones said. "Maryland just kept coming at us and then during that one stretch, I think Gary saw that we looked a little bit tired." After Gist's dunk made it 52-48, Caner-Medley sank a free throw and Gilchrist made a layup. Ibekwe followed with a tip-in, D.J. Strawberry added a 3-pointer and Gilchrist scored on a drive to put the Terps up by 14. Ibekwe then hit a layup and Garrison made two free throws before Raimondas Petrauskas ended American's 5-minute scoreless drought with a jumper in the lane. "We played pretty well for 30 minutes or so," Jones said. Thomas hit three 3-pointers in the opening 6 minutes, and the Eagles went 7-for-9 from the field in going up 18-13. But American missed its next four shots, and the Terrapins got points from four players in a 9-0 run that gave them their first lead. American answered with 10 straight points, half by Andre Ingram, before Maryland used a 9-2 surge to take a 36-34 halftime lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
